Passengers who have lost property on c2c stations or trains should contact the c2c Lost Property line or complete the web-form.

Passengers will be contacted if their item has been found.
Passengers requiring assisted travel bookings can contact us, where we will provide as much assistance as possible in order to help you make arrangements for your journey.
We would be happy to help you with after sales support should you have any problems buying tickets from our website.

We would be delighted to help you make arrangements for your Group Travel needs.

Please do get in touch, we may be able to offer you a special price, or charter your very own train.
We would be happy to discuss with you any Corporate Travel requirements as well as Higher Education colleges who may be interested in our Student Smartcard scheme.

Advance booking is essential. Tickets can be collected from the office (Bicester North station) or posted to you - please allow 3 working days.

Opening hours

Monday to Friday - 09:30 - 16:00

Business travel account services

  • With one phone call, fax or email, you can book all your tickets, reserve seats and get journey planning advice for the entire National Rail network.
  • Complete itemised journey itinerary with onward connection information and any restrictions that apply.
  • Advice on Standard and 1st Class travel.
  • Immediate confirmation.
  • Seat, sleeper and dining car reservations where available.
  • London Underground Travelcards.
  • Order season tickets for your employees by phone or fax.
  • Tickets sent to you by First Class post, or collect them from our Business Travel Centre at Bicester North Station.
  • All for free, not a penny extra.

Opening hours

Monday to Friday - 09:30 - 16:30

All Group Travel must be booked in advance: 7 days in advance for up to 49 passengers. 4 weeks in advance for 50 passengers or more. Special arrangements may need to be made for groups of more than 100.

"If you are travelling in a group of 10 or more people we ask that you contact our Group Travel  team, who will be able to direct you to trains with sufficient seats for your group and also advise you on the best value for money ticket option as you may qualify for a group discount on your tickets as well.

Seat Reservations are free of charge on all London North Eastern Railway services.

Seat Guarantee provides compensation to customers who have a seat reservation for a specific train journey and for whatever reason, cannot get a seat anywhere onboard that train. Full details can be founds at

www.LNER.co.uk

BuyingTickets.com:Note:
We appreciate that sometimes you will not be able to buy a ticket at the station before you board, due to the ticket office being closed or self-service ticket machines not working. If this happens speak to our onboard staff, who will find out why the problem occurred and issue you with the cheapest available ticket for your journey.

If you board without a ticket where the ticket office was open and/or self-service ticket machines were working, you will be liable to purchase the Anytime Single or Return ticket to complete your journey.

Get a valid ticket before you travel.

You must have a valid ticket of a Permit to Travel for your entire journey before you  go, otherwise you could have to pay a Penalty Fare.

This is at least £20 or double the full single fare to the next station stop. Plus the usual single fare to your destination if you continue your journey.

You might also have to pay a Penalty Fare if you:

  • Can't show an appropriate Railcard for a discounted ticket
  • Travel in a First Class carriage with a Standard Class ticket
  • Are travelling on a Child rate ticket but are 16 or over
  • Travel beyond the destination on your ticket.

Tickets are available for purchase on-board our trains only when a journey commences from a station that does not have ticket purchasing facilities or where ticket buying facilities are out of order.

TrainOperatingCompany.Name: London Underground
TrainOperatingCompany.LegalName: London Underground Ltd, Transport for London (TfL)

com:Annotation.com:Note: 24 hours a day on every day where a train service runs
Customer Services are available between 07:00 and 22:00, 7 days a week.

BuyingTickets.com:Note:
Where the opportunity to purchase a ticket exists at the station before boarding the train then the passenger must purchase a ticket for their entire journey. If a passenger chooses not to buy their ticket when they have the opportunity to do so and purchases their ticket on the train then they will be charged the full standard open single or return fare, irrespective of the day and time of travel.

Where there is no ticket office or ticket machine then the passenger may purchase a ticket on the train. In these circumstances the passenger will be charged the appropriate fare for the journey that is being undertaken taking into account the day and time of travel.

Tickets must be purchased before boarding the train. If a passenger boards a train without a ticket they might be liable for a Penalty Fare, and will only be able to purchase a fully priced ticket for their journey, railcard discounts will not apply.
